title: Confidence Explanation Generation

TIER1.template:
HIGH CONFIDENCE: {disease_name} is an {category} disease. 
Our model performs exceptionally well for {category} conditions because:
- Similar {category} diseases share treatment mechanisms
- Strong knowledge graph connectivity between {category} diseases and their treatments
- Historical validation shows 93-100% of top-30 predictions contain effective drugs

TIER2.template:
MEDIUM CONFIDENCE: {disease_name} is a {category} disease.
Our model has moderate reliability for {category} conditions:
- Predictions above 0.6 confidence achieve ~80% precision
- {category} diseases have some treatment mechanism overlap
- Recommend validating top predictions against literature before prioritizing

TIER3.template:
LOW CONFIDENCE: {disease_name} is a {category} disease.
Our model has limited reliability for {category} conditions because:
- {category} diseases have weak connectivity in our knowledge graph
- Similar diseases in embedding space are often from different categories
- These predictions should be treated as exploratory only
- Consider specialized databases for {category} drug repurposing

findings:
Successfully generated human-readable explanation templates for each confidence tier.

IMPLEMENTATION:
1. Map disease category → tier (TIER1/2/3)
2. Select explanation template based on tier
3. Fill in disease name, category, and metrics
4. Output includes both qualitative explanation and quantitative metrics

VALUE:
- Helps users understand WHY a prediction is trusted
- Provides actionable guidance (validate/explore/avoid)
- Increases transparency and appropriate use of predictions
